review: Customer service was horrible. We sat at our table for 25 minutes no one waited on us, no one came to ask if we needed water or anything. I had asked 3 diffrent people what was going on is someone coming they all just looked crazy. When they finally came she told us we had to automatically tip i told her no and to get the manager When he finally came he was being an asshole he told me to pretty much come correct to get what i want etc. And i did just that i told him politely i wasnt going to come at him in any way becuase it wasnt a need the way he came to the table was rude. I told him about the service and that i was not tipping a waiter or anyone for that matter 25 minute wait thats absurd.

If I could give a worse rating than 1. Listing in bullet points would be a better delivery of the dismal service my friends and I received. 1. We were sitting at our table for more than 5 minuets before we were greeted by our server.  2. It took her more than 10 minuets before my friends and I received our waters. (We were parched from a long day of working in the sun.) 3. Then, after neglecting to put in our order in, she brought out our appetizer with our entree. 4. When my friend ordered a second beverage, spent definitely 5 min talking to her friends away from the bar. 5. She finally brought out her drink, then the check right after and neglected to bring the to go box we requested. 6.  On the check, she put a request for us to pick a tip percent. None of which we found fit. 7. Then as my friends and I are leaving, she had the audacity to come after us with a security guard and ACCUSED MY FRIENDS AND I OF SKIPPING ON THE CHECK! She said and I quote " You didn't pay your tab, did you?" 8. When explaining our horrible experience to the security guard, as our server was inside checking  the book we left visible on the table, he said "I'm not surprised that's the service you got." 9. Then to top it all off, she didn't have the stomach to apologize for the blatant disrespect. My friends and I are all in the service industry and we were completely appalled with our treatment in this particular TGI Fridays.  So thank you Paris, we had a blast.
My family and I came here for an early dinner. There were 15 of us! Antoine was our server and he did an amazing job. He was patient and attentive. Bravo!!!

This TGI Fridays on 66th and Cicero was accommodating - the waiter - but the tibs were not good. They were stiff and almost cold. I didn't enjoy them at all. The stars were for the excellent waiter. I can give none to the ribs. The loaded mash potatoes were good. Because I have had other items there that were good I know to never order their ribs again.

We went out tonight to celebrate my daughter's academic achievements. She chose this restaurant to celebrate. TGI Friday's used to be better than this. I drove out of my way and avoided the Oak Park location because I though that I would get better service here. The service wasn't bad, but it could've been better. It was slow first of all. They need to hire more staff for busy nights. We didn't have to wait for a table. He (Bobbie) took forever to take our drink and food order. It took longer than average for the food to come out. I ordered the Jack Daniels Ribeye steak. I asked for it to be cooked done, not well done. The steak was definitely overcooked and it was also thin. I had mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese as sides. Of course the sides were small portions. He did apologize for our wait time, so I guess it was acceptable. It was also cold in the restaurant. The whole TGI Friday franchise need improvements.

We always love our food every time we are here, never fails! We had great service tonight from Kingsley, it was really crowded but he always took the time to check on us and see if there was anything we needed! There almost always a wait to get seated here, price of good food!

Service with Don prompt, professional and friendly. I live in the neighborhood and come here once in a while, and have never had a bad experience at this location.  Will definitely come again, and might even have the Brownie Obsession as my main course lol (it's soooo good!).

I now remember why I avoid this chain nation wide The pot stickers appetizers were not cooked properly  The shrimp that were with my JD NY strip were not cooked and the Strip was over cooked, the sweet potato fries were soggy and had regular fries mixed in. The side Caesar salad had Kale mixed in. The service was fine but that's only part of the equation.

Food is good but take out service was excellent! Mike took care of us. Cheerfully took our order, ensured he got it right, and made the whole transaction great!  I requested something just added to Friday's and not yet on the menu. Mike went out of his way to find it and make it available. Every business needs more employees like Mike!

I'm always weary of restaurants due to my oldest sons allergy. However this place was top notch. Very clean, an awesome server in Eddie and the food was delicious. Pretty hip that we can have a great meal before we fly out for our adventure. We strongly recommend the baby back ribs and the Cobb salad. And if you have kids definitely let them enjoy a slushy with free refills!
Why haven't I learned my lesson.  I know Friday's Sucks. They all suck.  I ordered the salmon. They didn't have the lobster sauce. It was so tiny it looked like an appetizer.

First and foremost I would like to give a heads up to all of you vegetarians out there: the options are quite limited for us. And by quite, I mean little to none. Seeing as I didn't want just leaves or soup for dinner, I ended up ordering the veggie burger out of these two options. Let me just throw out here as well, there is not one healthy option here on the menu. However, if you're like me and change it up a bit, then you're meal will not be too artery clogging as the rest. For one, you can order the burger green style (lettuce bun) which was great in my opinion. Anyway, our waiter was very nice and patient with my longer order listing what I didn't want with my burger and such. My meal came as expected, and I was very please with the quality and taste of it. Although, a little complaint of mine is that I ordered my salad without cheese, and it still was brought with it. Other than that, the experience was nice and while I most likely won't be eating here again unless a friend wants me to come along, I will say that TGI wasn't too bad at all.

I've been here many times on business trips and have to say for a major chain it's actually pretty good. Good food, good selection, decent prices and the staff "at the bar" has always been fast and friendly.

Ate here twice, thinking that first time was just an off night. However, both nights were the same, food lacks flavor. Service both nights were slow. Servers don't seam to be there for their customers. Food is not warm when delivered had to wait for silverware to start meal first night. The restaurant, and I use that word sparingly, was not busy either times. Don't waste your time, and abuse you palette. I don't frequent McDonald's, but it may be a better choice.
Another shitty tgi Fridays. Piss poor bar service. You have to be desperate to go here.
Stopped by to have a couple of Drinks on a date. Was extremely impressed with how nice our bartender was. Definitely coming back for one of Gigi's drinks at this place.

I live close to two Fridays locations but  my friends and I choose to come to this location due to the great service provided by the staff here but specifically Maribel the bartender. She provides over the top service. I've been here at times when it's extremely busy and she still provides good service making us feel as if we were the only ones there due to her attentiveness and always has a smile and awesome personality. We don't come here too often but when we do she remembers our names and also remembers our favorite drinks! The little things that make a Big difference for us. Never a dull moment when we choose to sit at the bar with Maribel.

Was staying at the attached hotel and ordered their ribs and shrimp.  Neither were very good.  Not quite sure what they did wrong as Friday's baby back ribs are usually good.  But perhaps an off night. The room service was prompt, and the staff friendly.

I was here today with my family and we were assisted by Antwan. He provided us with stellar services. Antwan made recommendations for the menu and they were exactly what we wanted. Our experience was made phenomenal because of Antwan.

I brought a group of 20 to this location for a simple, informal baby gender reveal party, and the accommodations were absolutely perfect! Every other restaurant I called, including another Friday's location, wanted to complicate things far more than necessary or did not have simple customer service accommodations in place for a group our size. From my first phone call with Angie, to her greeting us once we arrived and making sure we were taken care of, the staff was just awesome and everything was simple. The staff even weighed in on the Team Boy/Team Girl action and joined in our moment of excitement when the * pink * cake was cut. I'm so grateful to Angie and the team for supportive such a special, memorable and fun milestone! I am definitely a fan of this location. Thanks so much!

Came in on this Saturday afternoon because I desperately needed a cocktail, I just came from the Vet and had to put my cat down.   Considering they had a couple large groups we got good service.   Good cocktail menu.   We just had appetizers, quesadillas and pot stickers.   Food was fine, no complaints.

I'm kinda done with Fridays.  In fact, I've been done with them for years.  This is a spacious place and a decent bar, but the food is just so-so. Remember when Fridays was all about the appetizers and hearty entrees?  Not any more.  I ordered the Mediterranean Shrimp Naan, and it was a let down.  Smallish wrap with no more than five medium-size shrimp, if even that many.

This place is going down. Waited for over 30 mins for a table when clearly 7-10 tables were empty. We were sat right around the corner from the bar where the booth was empty along with a few more. I asked the hostess which there were about 6. Why are so many needed when only half greet you and other just stand there? The answer was short staff in the kitchen.  Waitress was nice and we ordered our food and strip chips. kids food came out food and so did our appetizers yet no chips. Finally chips came and our dinner. I ordered steak and my wife the sizzling chicken with shrimp. It wasn't sizzling nor was it made like before. the cheese was on the bottom and chicken and shrimp places on top. Looked very bland and we did send it back. Went to bathroom which the door hasn't been fixed in years. approx 12 empty tables and once again a line of people waiting to be seated. I did mentioned to the staff that the restaurant was going down hill with the new evening manager which they agreed.

Food was brought out barely hot.. Remade the food then brussel sprouts missing there toppings someone brought out an xtra as I was telling her so she gave me that one.. Bottom line my food wasn't all that at this location.. Took aboutv45 min 2 bring my order 4 it 2 arrive cold.. I probably want venture back 2 this location however the waitress was nice after she touched my hot wings on my burger 2 c them being nearly ice cold .. Normally I get a cheese cake I don't want $#!+ else from here .. I'm just ready to go .. Got here at 8pm n its after 11pm.. I told her I was giving a bad review.. Guess they don't too much give a damn.. The table next 2 us required the manager as well.. We ask 4 one also I don't even care I gotta go.. Been here way 2 damn long  .. My cousin has 2 catch a flight she's pissed bc we wasted so much time here she wanted 2 relax a bit but not anymore I don't even wanna drop her off I just wanna go to sleep this totally changed my mood
As far as restaurants chains, Friday's is one of the best. Always get quality food. Great atmosphere. Haven't been here in a while; noticed the prices went up.... but overall ok here.

I was pretty excited to come here, and every time I do the wait is so long we leave. But today Saturday we waited about 10 minutes which was great. Our server Jesus was super nice and attentive with us. He made my dinner here great. We ordered 2 bruschetta chicken pastas .. as far as I remember from 3 years ago at another TGI the pasta is angel hair, with little to no tomato sauce because it's not a tomato pasta.. and the chicken is supposed to be nice and grilled ! I loved this dish. The food came out and yeah, i was pretty disappointed. So much tomato sauce, the chicken was almost raw I didn't eat it. It was hard for such little pieces it's impossible to not cook it right. I'll stick to my other location at Rosemont.

I recently ordered at this restaurant while I was staying at the courtyard Marriott yesterday. My lover and I wanted to order some food since it was the closest restaurant to us. We both ordered two steaks medium, and we asked for the steaks to be seasoned.  We went to pick our order only to find there was no seasoning on the steaks. The host was very nice and got the cooks to remake the steaks. The host brought the order to our hotel room, but the steaks were burned to a crisp. The host had them remade again, and the order was finally correct. We also were given a refund for the meal, but it over 2 hours for the order to be corrected. I can't say I would ever given this chain another dollar.

I have tried to give THIS location a 2nd and 3th chance but I have never enjoyed my meal. Last nite it was over cooked .my Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp.platter. Please dont mess up my seafood Ugh. I learned dont send it back kso I ate it but grudgingly. I do like the cleaniest of the restaurant . But the food is always lackluster

The worst TJI Fridays in the country and I will make sure corporate will hear about it  Zero service - first directed to a dirty table with many clean ones all over free to take  - not a busy Sunday night  Seated .... Waiting ... Waiting ... Waiting  15 min no service no question compete ignorance  Oh by the way ... Waiter or waitress didn't passed me once  Walked out  You have to be kidding me  That manager needs to be out on red carpet asap

So this is my second time coming here. The first time I got up and left after 20 mins of waiting for a waiter. Now this time I said let's give them another change. 15 mins later I alerted a host and informed her we have no been served. Then after 10PM they add 18% tip to bill And you don't even get good service. Never again
Not enough Russian food. I wanted to eat bear. Also add a touch of communism it the fries and I will Chan's this to 6 stars
Oh no... stepping into this establishment...was stepping into rancid smells of damp clothes molded cheese + sweaty feet . Didn't even order.

I visited this Friday's yesterday around 9PM. Sat at the bar with my friend had a salad and a cocktail. I ordered a Jack Daniel's medium Steak & Shrimp at first, however, it did not look like a steak it looked like processed meat and definitely wasn't medium, more like well done.  After sending that back ...  I ordered "Sizzling Chicken & Shrimp" - Hold the onions. After eating half the plate of food ... I had an extremely nauseous moment. I turned to look at my friend with my mouth covered and immediately ran towards the bathroom.  After about 20 steps ....I instantly threw up all the food near the kitchen entrance. Here's the best part ... 1. The manager never came to see if I was okay.  2. I had to call for the manager to come talk to me because they were still trying to charge me for the meal that I threw up.  3. Not only did she have terrible managerial skills ... She had the audacity to have a debate with me and tell me she wasn't going to refund my meal that I "threw up" since I finished nearly the whole plate.  4. I never finished the plate, plus, I threw the half that I had up on their floor. Long story short ... I "loved" TGI Friday's anyone can tell you that it was my go to spot. I even accumulated more then 2,000 reward points. So I ate their for free all the time. After threatening the manager with legal actions she eventually took the meal off my tab. I still paid for the salad and cocktail.  I haven't been to a TGI Friday's ever since, I don't plan on going anytime soon and definitely not back to this location. Worst experience of my life.
Had a wonderful time for lunch on Wednesday September 20, 2017 with my special friend Jay.

The service was horrible.  The waitress actually said that they were out of coffee. She didn't even know that she had to make coffee. You can imagine how everything else went. Turned out the waitress was NOT brand new. She had been there for at least two weeks! The manager was combative. I waited 20 minutes for a drink because the bartender was in the back. The manager actually asked me if there wasn't another staff member around to make it. How am I supposed to know?!  I asked for and was not given the store number. I called 1-800-Fridays and complained. Waiting to see if they do anything.

Chips and Salsa - bland.  Flat Iron Steak - tasty but gristle-filled.  Waitress - far below average.  Manager a condescending clown who talks over the customers rather than listen to their concerns.  Spend your money someplace else where it will be better appreciated.

Came out with my family for a birthday & the waiter informed us that it was a 18% gratuity​ on each endless appetizer.... When they start doing that? I'm so upset & disappointed. I think this need to be looked into
I just think TGIF is nasty. Ate here a few times in past few years. I think food is over priced and very cheap quality.

Walked here from Hilton garden inn. Good menu, food pretty good. Service started off slow then picked up and was great (Don?). Only complaints are 1) no Happy hour and 2) my blackberry tea, with 4 types of liquor, had minimal liquor. Otherwise, the BBQ flat bread and strawberry spinach salad were delicious.

Excellent!!! Angie was the best..We popped in with a group of 22 and needed to be in and out to meet an appointment.  After a long flight delay we were about five hours behind schedule..She got us seated..Ordered and out the door in our time frame with a great smile and good conversation....Checking in on us often and assisting with shuttle service to airport....The food was good too but most importantly customer service from Angie superb! Go Cubs....T G I F..If in Chicago go see Angie..I know if we return to the area.we will!

Unfortunately Hooters was full and this was the last resort, and can I stress that this was the LAST RESORT! Someone shoot me right now! What was I thinking?  Our waiter felt the need to pick up my phone because of its cover and said "oh that's really cool".  If this is any Indication to how this visit will be, "OH LORD"!  Appetizers: hmmm cheese sticks seem burnt. I think it's the oil, but the green beans (fried) are not bad. Boneless chicken wings are pretty good and the sauces are decent. The only thing I didn't appreciate was the fact that I saw our waiter cleaning (pretending while he watched the Basketball game) and didn't care if he picked up food plates and still serve.  I do have to say that the customers seemed to of had a night off from Bellevue Mental Institution. I mean, I know no one knows one another, judging by the different themes that they are all bringing  to each table (but wow is there something in the water up in here). I refuse! These customers were really on something, and judging by the odor of THC (tetrahydracanabinol) I think its safe to say, its a definite hit.  The Black Bean burger tasted so much like a can of black beans, needed salt (and I NEVER salt my food), the fries were as limp as a gay man waiting to watch a bunch of woman streak the San Antonio Astrodome!  Seeing the workers all just doing their own thing and just watching the basketball game while ignoring customers was really disappointing. Not to mention the waiter putting us in a small 2 seat banquet. Just the most uncomfortable situation, but of course, we couldn't have a bigger table since it was just two of us. And mind you, I am far from being a size 30! Just not a good situation. I will not go on, but seeing as I asked a few people what their experiences were at the TGIF family, and many said the same thing, they lack a certain air of caring. Its more sit, order and get out!

I have been to this location three times over the past few years. First time was great, second time was iffy, the third time was my last. When you walk into a place, and the first thing you see is a card on the table telling you the service is so excellent that after 10:00 pm they have to charge you an 18% gratuity, that tells me you don't want to be there for several reasons. I will only elaborate on two. The service and the food.  I was greeted at the door and offered seating at the bar or a high top. I asked for a regular table, and watched the hostess give whoever was at the door with her an eye roll. Minus five, right there. There were tables all over, and I had to be seated at a dirty two top... That never got wiped off. By the time my soup came with a spoon, I still had not been given a napkin or other silverware. I had to ask for it when my salad came.  I ordered a chicken club baguette to carry out and eat when I got back to my hotel room. I finished my soup and salad, and was brought my check along with the carry out box with my sandwich on a plate.  I was never asked if I wanted a refill on my soda. I was brought a check without the gratuity added, then another one with the gratuity added. I really should have asked to speak with the manager, but I try to be a little conscious of the fact that some folks might be having a bad day, so I didn't.  I also didn't appreciate hearing my waitress and a bus person complaining about another employee, and how she needed to go "F" herself.... An hour later the sandwich was inedible. It smelled bad, the bacon was undercooked, the chicken was dry and salty, the avocado was gross... I took one bite, started removing the nasty parts, and ended up with a low quality baguette. Needless to say, the garbage can got the whole mess. So... In closing... I realize that they probably have a tipping issue with their late night clientele, but regarding the imposed 18% gratuity, all I saw was an excuse for the waitstaff to slack off and get away with poor service.  I'll go somewhere else the next time I have to spend the night in the hotel next door.

Ok I came here with my so. Luigi and my mom we had drinks and I ordered a French onion soup it was very delicious not salty at all just perfect.  My mom and I split an order of ribs.  For a fast food restaurant the ribs were very good.  We also had desert I really loved it.  I like this TGI Friday because it has a huge parking lot and the restaurant is pretty busy it is not too far from Midway airport so I think the food moves fast.  Meaning the food is fresh.  I can give it a 5 but it way too busy and loud with kids running around.

Don't believe the poor reviews or you will be sorry!! Don't believe the poor reviews or you will be sorry!! We stayed at the hotel next to this location and due to the crappy reviews we almost skipped it. Thankfully we made a u turn and came back after realizing everything in the area had a horrible review. Now front desk girl wasn't too bubbly.. She was obsessed by the seating grid and really took no notice of us mentioning that we were avoiding this place due to reviews. The girl that seats you and our server Aisha were super in tune and wanted to make our experience great. Food was good. Service was good. Place was clean. Order was done quickly and I have to say," Try it for yourself!"

Josh our server was very efficient! Checked on us very often! Very quick with our drinks! Friendly staff. Had the steak with mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese. Mashed potatoes were amazing! Asked for medium cooked steak but got more of a medium well (but had that in consideration when making the order... Seeing as how this isn't a steakhouse) wouldn't recommend getting the Mac and cheese.... Dry and not very tasteful at all. Also had the shrimp/chicken Alfredo... Not bad but not amazing. Satisfied about the atmosphere and service and food was great considering I was expecting so-so food (seeing as how i don't expect much from chained restaurants)

For the owner:  3pm Sunday 8/2/15 ... Two bartenders of which one was drunk...I mean really drunk. The service sucked.  Even other patrons were like stunned.  The second bartender...blonde dude, tried taking up the drunks slack but wasn't able to and so the service, well, still sucked.  The restaurant is corporate owned so don't expect the menu on TGIF's website: $10.00 bottomless appetizer....NOT. The restaurant wasn't busy.  2 stars. One for the dude working his butt off to take up the drunks slack and, one for the kitchen...the food came quick WHEN we were finally able to order it.

Honest review: its jus like houlihans n all those other hipster fastfood places that claim they have the best food. The food is not good its just fast food dont expect a gormea meal here. For the price i rather go somewhere actually good

Getting ready to fly out in the early morning and stopped in here for a lite dinner because it was close to the hotel.   Everything was SPOT on. Service , drinks and food, were all great. Ahi tuna app and some sliders.  Very well done.  I know it's a chain but they do it right here.   Kudos

Service was not good today !! Got my order wrong  and to ask for silverware . Was not offered water or anything else. I'm very disappointed as I have been here everyday for almost 2 weeks and I still have several more days to go as I'm here working.

Since I live near the restaurant I placed a order to go and was transfer three times before someone final took my order. I ordered a Cobb salad and a beef sandwich and it horrible. I highly recommend to avoid this restaurant.

Went in for a drink with my husband later in the evening. Was a little put off by a police officer sitting on duty there in the lobby... Still not sure what that was all about? Not really an issue, just odd. The bar tenders were friendly and prompt. We didn't have anything to eat. Clean, friendly, and quick.
Food was fantastic but the bartender couldn't make a Manhattan to save his/her life! Drinks were very watered down. Recommend skipping straight to the menu and enjoy the meal!

First time used this place. Nice people, fantastic food, good service. Thank you very much. Four stars, because to mach oil and white sauce was  my plate...heavy ,but maybe just  for me, because I'm not use fat food a lot.

I've eaten here a few times in the past year and this is likely to be my last. The location is easy to get to within the Midway Airport Hotel Center and parking is never an issue. Parking lot is patrolled by security and is well lit. This TGIFriday is my least liked of the 20+ I have visited. Here the associates always greet you as expected but that's where the smiles end. Wait staff are usually unhappy sour people and this evening our waiter even told us he was having a terrible day. It's always difficult to get drink refills here both alcohol and soft drinks and tonight I had to again flag down another waiter to finally get another beer. Food is average for a TGIFriday and plates are often hot and food dry from sitting under warming lamps too long.  Better to eat at the Asian place across the street on Cicero with great food and service even if the parking lot is small.
Not that good I got a cold steak and a lame tasteless soda  Was my only choice as it is close to my hotel and I do not have a car I do not recommend it.. Sorry
Friendliest staff  If you are lucky enough to have Artice for a waitress you are in fantastic hands!!!!

Came here on a Friday night 11/4/2016 with my lover after leaving Applebee's down the street. I thought I was going to recieve the same terrible service here as I did down the street because it was so crowded and the Cubs parade had just ended. It was packed with tourists and fans alike so I was prepared to turn around until we were greeted as soon as we walked in and told it would be a 10 minute wait. We sat in the waiting area with other patrons and sure enough about 10 minutes later we were called and seated in the back quietly at a table. Our waitress was a kind lady with glasses that waited our table and got our drinks promptly water and cocktails. We placed our order for appetizers and entrees and two more drinks. The appetizers came out piping hot with the other drinks. The potato wedges were a bit dry but everything was great on our appetizer trio. Our food came and was hot as well, I ordered the parmasean crusted chicken with broccoli and mozzarella tomato salad. The chicken breast was small but well seasoned and the broccoli was okay. I was looking forward to the mozzarella and tomato salad but it had too many red onion and not enough mozzarella. All in all I was pleased with the service and food. I always enjoy this Fridays

beware!!!!! this tgif will not honor any tgif specials.... nice staff if you just have to use them but i was coming with my family to take advantage of their specials.... boo-hoo they are not a "corporate" tgif restaurant  next time i will be going to the one on 95th in oaklawn!

Since there's no longer a TGI Friday's in my hometown, my family and I took full advantage of the opportunity to have lunch here. Our server, Jacquelin, was great and attentive to our needs. The Jack Daniels chicken was as delicious as I remembered it to be. Not one crumb was left on my plate!

I've always hated TGI Friday's and did not plan on coming here but my friends preferred this place for the variety of food choice. Well, enter Mr. Crabby Pants. The server was really douchey since he hated working there. Oh well. The food was fine. I had the veggie flatbread pizza and it was fine.  Refilling of beverages? Yea, only if you asked. Oh well. Was only there for my friends due to the location. Will open up a can the next time someone asks me to go there. Not gonna happen.

First of all who runs out of coffee. Especially at a restaurant right next to an airport where weary travellers come from.  50 percent empty yet a long wait. Sloooooooow service. Wrong food.  And the host cackling with two ladies leaning his butt over my shoulder so he could chat with his friends. I learned.  .....while I waited a loooong time for food. That he works 3 days a week and is saving his money. I also learned that his sister lives like 110th and Cicero and it takes a long time to get there. And that he has a really annoying voice  If it is always Friday in there.... its a slooow day. With lazy hosts....and waiters who cant find coffee or get food right.  Unlike Fridays in Schaumburg by the mall this place is not traveler or hungry person friendly.

I had the blue cheese burger, since it had been some time since I've had one. I wasn't impressed. It was just ok. However, the staff was very friendly and good service. Good place to stop in have some appetizers and a few beers.

Me and my friend went in Valentine's Day, super busy. Thankfully we were over 21 so we could be seated at the bar immediately. As we were looking through the drink menu our waitress came in and told us their sweet drink deals. Totally thankful for $3 long islands! Then she informed us with appetizer specials and sold! They were out in under 10 minutes! With it being super busy she did an excellent job checking in on us and getting our orders. The food was pretty delicious! I didn't have high hopes going in but they wowed me!

I was there a few weeks ago and was completely impressed.  I used to go b there often but I felt like it was starting to lapse on quality.  I was pleasantly surprised. They had just remodeled the entire restaurant.  It was opened up,  brighter,  and the food was excellent.  It was a great choice.

Friendly staff! Our waitress Veronika was awesome! She made sure our drinks were full and updated us with our food. They should have more employees like her! Thank you for serving us during our trip to Chicago!

Okay, I just went in and walked out. It's Thursday night and the waiting area is full. When walking in the restaurant the bf and I saw a ton of tables unoccupied. Wtf? The hostess just looked up at me didn't say a word, rolled her eyes at me when I said "two please" she then said "30 minute wait".  I don't pay for shitty attitudes and stupidity/laziness of not filling tables.
What has happened to tgif....!  Go to Coach's Bar and Grill  in the Holiday Inn Express, instead. I promise, you won't be sorry!

I just had dinner here with my friend tonight and enjoyed myself. We didn't have to wait to be seated. My cajun chicken and shrimp pasta was very good, the brownie obsession was excellent, and our server Don was great. I would definitely come back.
Not so bad for a dinner night with friends.. they do have a full bar which is nice.. Ambience is kind of ehh.
Well, they DO have fountain Diet Coke. I guess.  Everything else? SKIP. Trust me. Eating at Midway airport seems almost "culinary genius."  Cold soup + Drippy salad = FAIL.

This is a really nice location . The manager was very friendly and very accommodating so I really appreciated that.  It wasn't super crowded so we were waited on rihht away, and the food was hot and good.

Have eaten here quite frequently as I usually stay at hotel in Midway complex when I come to Chicago. The food is the food. Nothing exceptional, but consistent. You know what you are going to get. The service is usually hit or miss. It goes from the server being overly attentive, almost annoying, to "where is my server?". Also, as I usually dine alone, it is inevitable that the host always tries to seat me in that two top by the kitchen service area, even though there are plenty of open tables. Of course, I ask to be seated somewhere else. Overall, a decent place to eat. Good variety in the menu. The restaurant just went through a remodel, so the atmosphere is fresh and it is also clean.
Friday's.  At least you know what you're gonna get...
Awesome staff and bartenders !!!  Great drinks and food at an affordable price!!! Excellent Lunch

This place ruined my farewell dinner. I came in to the half empty place with a party of 8 (5 adults, 3 kids) 90 minutes before I had to leave for airport. The host said it would be a 15 minutes wait. We got seated 30 minutes later after large and small parties who came in before and after were seated before us. Our waitresses kept insisting the designated driver have a large drink (really?!). My order had to be sent back because it was wrong - no cheese means no cheese.  By the time, I had to leave my family to go to the airport, my cousin's food still hadn't arrived. I got my food to go and ate my mayonnaise-soaked farewell dinner in the car.  :-( never again

Me and a friend went to go eat there today we had a male waiter Hispanic who was awesome he had a great attitude he was on time with everything and he was very patient with us I don't remember his name but we were there around 2 o'clock this afternoon on Thursday the second of April I ordered some potato skins which were so dry it felt like it came from a desert my female friend ordered the spinach dip which is really good but it's not the waiter's fault its the kitchen's fault other than than that everything was great
Had dinner there a month ago on a layover.  My husband had a burger and I had a really tasty salad.  The food was very good and our server that night was excellent.

Let me just start by saying........OZZIE!!!(i think that's how you spell it) WAS PHENOMENAL!!!!!! Great attitute...great service...very attentive!!!!! He was great!!!! My bf and I enjoyed the service!!!!!!! I gave a good tip and RANG THE BELL!!!!!!!(for great service)
Had a wonderful dinner tonight here and the team at the bar (where we ate) was really great!!!

Came for a dinner date but was reluctant due to the fact that tgif has been mediocre at best.  Still we gave it a shot and were glad we did. The food was surprisingly delicious. I had a jack burger and for appetizer we got spinach artichoke my date got a chicken sandwich.  The staff was friendly and while they did take longer than I would like they explained they had a large party and were a little busier than usual.  Even the manager came to apologize even though we said nothing.  tgif is back on the map.

Most people seem to know what to expect from a TGI Friday's, however this was my first visit to one and overall, I was quite pleased. The food was good, however the best part about the experience was our server. My cousin and I are vegetarians and the TGI Friday's menu is pretty far from veggie-friendly. However, our server was so helpful in helping us put together some good meals and she was very friendly. If they had more veggie options, I would always want to come back. Oh, and the Oreo shake is delicious!

I order there regularly, and normally, there ok with pickup orders. However, this time I called in to order, 'betty'  the lady who answered, had me hold on for 5 minutes, then i hung up and called back, and told them I had waited too long, she got mad and put me on hold again and I waited another 10 minutes. I had to call from a different phone number and my order was taken immeadiately!! This 'betty' makes her company look like loosers!!!! My wife went and picked up the order, and she wondered why i held on so ong, they was NOT busy at all in there, she said.. OMG

I have never been to this place but ordered room service for 3 days in a row. The deliverer was always nice,  friendly with great smile and I got a follow up phone call to my room afterwards! I feel they care about customer satisfactions.

the service could have been better i didn't know who my waiter was i had so many different people coming to the table..and the manger was walking around talking to everyone like bothering them ..but the food is so yummy very pricey though for my budget but over all good service can work on it though thats why i give 2 stars

I have been here several times and have had good and bad experiences.  This review is for the last time we went.  I took my great nieces and nephew for dinner and all of us had something different.  I had the Jack Daniels glazed ribs and a cocktail (Malibu and Cranberry Juice).  The ribs were good, for once.  They were meaty and tender.  The fries were nice and hot.  I got a slice of the cheesecake to go and had it at home.  Other times I have eaten here and had the same entree, but it was horrible.  I had to send it back.  The ribs were undercooked and then, they burned them up.  This time I enjoyed it and everyone in my party enjoyed their food, as well.
Absolute garbage. Ignorant waitstaff and noisy environment. I'd rather keep driving to the one on 95th.

I drove my uncle (Tio) to Midway on Saturday night and in order to kill some time, we went to TGI Friday's.  The food wasn't bad.  We actually liked our meal, which was a turkey, ham and cheese sandwich and a cobb salad.  Here are the reasons why I am giving this establishment a 2-star rating.  First, our server, who was a nice kid, never offered us any water.  He pushed strawberry lemonade on us.  It was good, however, my uncle is diabetic.  Second, when I told my waiter that I had food allergies, he gave me a menu that indicates every dish and every allergen.  I thought the bread would have been made with eggs, so I asked for wheat bread.  They don't serve wheat bread.  WTF.  How can an established chain of processed food (heart attack on a plate, LOL) and institutionalized cooking NOT have wheat bread.  I don't think they even have any breads for gluten-free diets.  What's up with that?  LOL.  Lastly, and honestly, I don't want to sound like a snob, but this location seems to attract people who just don't have any couth.  Honestly, I was floored and astonished at the conduct of many of the patrons ... very young and immature ... On a bright note to recap, our food was okay, and our waiter was polite, however, in general, this place is lacking.

Had a night to spend in the Windy City when headed to Mesa, Az . This restaurant is located on a busy strip of motels near Midway Airport . Best part of the visit there was the bar service . ( Blue Moon on draft)  I ordered a burger medium and it was cooked almost to a hard char . Salad I ordered had wrong dressing . The staff did nothing to correct either mistake . A local resident sitting next to me then told me that "This place is not known for it's food ." But they were very busy ..Don't think I will be back .

So my steak was a little bit tough but I did ask for well done.  The staff was really really attentive despite it being crowded.  The boyfriend kind of stands out a little so one staff member actually came to ask him if he was a wrestler or football player in hopes of getting a pic & autograph to hang in the restaurant but of course, he was not!  Still, I doubt the service was different because of who they may have though he was!  I was still quite happy with my meal; everything lived up to it's advertizement & I was always able to see management doing his rounds in the place.  Did I mention that I could watch my sports from any chair I was seated at?!

had a kick ass time here a while ago cuz our waiter was so freakin cool! my gil and i ate at the bar area & he totally hooked us up with our drinks! they were yummy & strong! woooo hoooo! i cant even remember the food we ordered but i know our drinks were deeeelish! his name was andy & his service rocked!
I got the ribs and shrimp with broccoli and mashed potatoes. It was perfect. Smooth environment as well. I love this place.

Came here a few weeks ago and can say the service has improved.  I would now rate the food on par with Chilis.  Unfortunately, that's not saying much.  I think TGI's is finally recognizing that if they couldn't put forth a better product, they'd better start working on customer service.  Although, when we were waiting for our order a manager came by to ask how everything was going and ended up saying a few vulgarities to my wife about the baseball team we root for.  Doubt I'll be back but they get a B for effort on trying to improve.

Connected to the Marriott Courtyard by Midway Airport. Sat at the bar for service and they were great! The food was typical for a Friday's nothing fancy but the bar service was excellent. If you ever get stuck overnight traveling head over. You can even charge it to your room for the points!
Strong drinks and the steak was delicious, good mashed potatoes. The Barmaid served up some strong vodka sodas for only 3 bucks.

Great customer service from beginning to end!! We were greeted warmly, seated promptly, and our server (John) was at our table almost immediately, ready to take our drink orders. We took a little longer to decide on what we wanted, but John was very patient and continued to check on us. After ordering, our appetizer came out quickly and soon after that, our meal was kindly delivered to out table by the general manager. He was very nice! The food was cooked perfectly and plated well...seeing as many of the other Fridays I've been to usually throw the food sloppily on the plate quite carelessly. I have to say I really enjoyed my experience at this location and I would recommend it! And remember to ask for John's section! He was great!

This is the place to get a drink when you don't want to walk to Mr. C's and you are staying the hotel complex they have going on here. Granted you can get some food as well, but for that go to the Marriott and go into Dempsey's.

Unfortunately the Midway Hotel Complex has very limited choices on places to eat when staying at a hotel there, so I went to the TGI Fridays for dinner since it was across the parking lot. What a Mistake. I was greeted by a very friendly hostess who showed me to my table this favorable impression quickly faded. As I was sitting at my table there were numerous employees back and forth but no one came to my table. After 8 minutes my waiter walked by and said " I'll be with you in a minute", then almost 5 minutes later stopped by and tried to sell me some cocktail special without even asking me what I would like to drink. I ordered a beer and he left, so I started looking at the menu, I wasn't hungry for a big meal so I saw this "NEW" triple deck Reuben, the description said it had horseradish sauce on each of the layers along with the usual sauerkraut and swiss...that sounded interesting so when I finally got my beer I ordered the Reuben. I asked if I could get something else instead of fries since I am not into fried foods and I was told the only substitution would be chips, no salad or fruit. I took the chips. When my food arrived the chips were deep fried potato slices oozing grease and cold. The first bite of my Reuben was overwhelmed by the greasy buttery oil used to toast bread on a grill. There was no hint of Horseradish. I looked for my waiter and he was not to be found (the place wasn't busy at all) so I asked the busboy to get him. When he came, I asked him about the horseradish and he told me they were out so it wasn't on the sandwich (this was the primary reason I ordered it in the first place!) I asked for the manager and when he showed up I asked if my waiter was new, he wasn't. I told the manager about the length of time it took to get served and the lack of concern about the quality of food. I suggested that if the ingredients weren't available for an item the staff should know and it shouldn't be served. I suggested that retraining was in order and he told me he didn't think so! He dismissed me and walked away, then a few minutes later another beer showed up and I told my server I didn't order it and didn't want it (it was "on the house" to make up for the poor service and food. I didn't finish my meal as it was gross). I asked for the manager again and when he came over I asked if the restaurant was a franchise or corp unit and I asked for contact information. When my check arrived there was no charge and the phone number and contact name was written. There were no apologies, nothing. Because this restaurant has a "captive audience" and due to the lack of other eating places I guess they figure the quality of food and service doesn't matter because they are pretty much the only place and you get what they give you. I strongly recommend that if you stay in the Midway Hotel Complex, DON'T eat here. Go to the McDonald's a few blocks away. You'll get better food and service for sure!!

Pretty standard, they have some good "healthy" choices on the menu. Had the dragon fire chicken, seemed fresh...good strong flavor on the mango salsa. Very small amount of broccoli, which left the plate half empty...rice pilaf was bland and flavorless. The chicken was cooked well and made up for the sides. Also, this was the loudest restaurant I have ever been in my life. The waitress had to lean right down to my mouth to hear my order. Not sure why it was so deafening on a tues night....seemed there might have been a lot of conference people enjoying happy hour

My plane was diverted because of a storm and I found myself at TGI Friday's late at night.  I hadn't eaten at a TGI Friday's since 1988.  I ordered the chicken noodle soup and the Iceberg Wedge with Warm Blue Cheese Dressing.  The soup was awful:  thickened with corn starch and way too salty.  The salad, however, was DELICIOUS!  I loved the combination of the cool, crisp lettuce with the creamy dressing and the crispy, salty bacon.  It was perfect!

June 14, 2012 - Dinner At this complex of hotels for Midway Airport there are 3 restaurants, one of which was TGI.  I wasn't wild about going to any of them, but this looked like the least of the not so good food. DRINKS: The Beefeaters Martinis were good and made with optional blue cheese stuffed olives.  That's on the plus side. APPETIZER: Ordered boneless buffalo wings.  They were good, no complaints. MEAL: I ordered their top of the line Jack Daniels Rib Eye steak.  Mediocre at best.  It was tough, thin and flavorless.  One of the poorer steaks I have had on the road.  It came with two sides and I took two sides of broccoli.  The broccoli was nearly raw, maybe blanched but very difficult to eat.  I don't like it over done, that's worst, but 5 minutes in a steamer is about right.  I did not finish the meat or the broccoli. SERVICE: Sat at the bar and bartenders were attentive.  Service was prompt, everything was good. QUALITY: Meats are not up to par, next time I'll stick with the hamburger. ATMOSPHERE: On a Thursday night the place was busy and I like that.  I hate sitting in a restaurant with just 4-5 people.  This was okay, it's predictable Friday's.

This place wreaks of human effluence, of the vomit variety. Perhaps I was here on an off night or something but the smell of vomit permeated the air and made it hard to finish my beer and get the hell out of there. On the upside I was grossly overcharged for my beer too!

In Chicago on business, staying at one of the hotel/motels near Midway, so TGI Friday's for dinner it was. I should have just walked a few more blocks to White Castle instead. I will say this, the beer selection is varied and excellent. And the bartenders were super nice and courteous. The food sucked. I ordered the pot stickers as an appetizer. They came back charred on the outside, cold on the inside. Really cold. Like they were frozen, and then put on a very hot grill to char, and then served. I sent them back and asked for no charge on those (which I got). The italian chicken sandwhich was average.  Come to think of it, the TGIF menu in general is pretty bad. So maybe it's not this location's fault. I would have given this place one star, but the service was actually good, so it got a second star. Barely.

The food was excellent and 6 Kay, was probably the reason I gave them a 5 star.  I was staying at the hotel, next door, and really didn't feel like driving anywhere, so I walked over to TGIF, right behind the hotel.  When I walked in, the line was almost all the way out the front door, so I knew there had to be something good about this place.  I'm not real crazy about most corporate restaurants, but wow, was I glad that I meandered over to this place.  I've always had good experiences at TGI Friday's, but this visit was the best.  First and probably most important, 6 Kay was an incredible server.  She did everything perfect, EVERYTHING.  I love it when servers engage their customers, in conversation and not just take your order.  I love to tip, people like 6 Kay.  I wasn't all that hungry, when I walked in, so I ordered the Jack Daniels sampler platter.  When my plate arrived, I thought to myself, there is no way I'm going to be able to eat half this food.  Well, I took the first bite of the ribs and It was all over but the shouting.  I actually ate the whole plate, and was a little miserable for doing so.  I don't know what happened, but I don't regret eating that whole plate of food.  I know what I'll be eating, next time I go to TGI Friday's.  This store is located, right down the street from Midway Airport.  It's really nice to find a great place to eat, when you're 1700 miles away from home.  If you read this Kay.  Thank you for being so incredibly good, at what you do.

I had a very decent meal consisting of a salad and soup.  I am not a chain person, but I was fairly pleased, considering this was about the only food option near the cluster of hotels at Midway.  Keep in mind, this is still Friday's...tacky decor, so-so service, etc.

its about the closest TGI restaurant near MDW. there is a cool little spot across the street that sells great food (thai mixed with Mexican) but if you just want some comfort food withouth getting stuck in traffic this is the place.

i hope you dont get dude with the two bootleg kwame yellow-blond streaks in his hair, he sucks! they place was not really crowded so why it took him forever to do anything is beyond me. thankfully the manager was walking through checking on people because she ended up serving us as much as he did. had to go hunt the idiot down to order, after waiting forever the manager had to bring us our drinks. after waiting forever for our food he finally brings it over minus our fries, he tells us our food was ready and jus sitting there waiting for the fries so he thought it would be a good idea to bring wat was ready and bring the rest later really? i had the salmon  with some sauce and lobster on top, they slightly overcooked the salmon but it was good, my side of zucchini and squash was good overall but left a spicy taste in my mouth. the manager ended up bringing the steaming hot fries near the end of the meal and they were very average. i like the downtown location better

They had some deal for 12.99 for a full 3 course meal.  Well "meal," and "course" could be used figuratively here.  But for 12.99 I decreased my lifespan and filled my stomach with mozzarella sticks, chicken strips, and later a vanilla bean cheesecake that was more whipped cream than cheesecake.  Want to know the secret to TGI Fridays and other such chains?  Stick to items that are also on the kids menu. Want to get fancy? Think they can get a steak right?  Come on now!  Basics people, basics.

Worst place ever. Lets start off with the most  annoying song in the entire world. if that birthday song was sung one more time: i was going to ask for a gun to shoot  myself. secondly, the food SUCKED. 2 small burgers on buns that way too sweet. my burger was the "southwest burger". It was supposed to have pepper jack, avocado,spicy onion strips, onions , and tomato. The worst were the spicy onion strips, because they were soggy and dripping with oil. The pepper jack cheese was just gross. all the other toppings were okay. The fries were are a very big sticking point for me for two reasons: the portion size and they were covered in salt and pepper. You get more fries in a small order at McDonald's, and they taste way better. not to mention the ridiculous amount of salt and pepper. The price was ridiculous 9.39 for a burger: i would at least expect for it to come with a drink, but no 3 dollars for a coke, i love coke but for three dollars c'mon that's just stupid expensive. However, while this place is a crap shack it has one redeeming quality: the waiter was actually good. Otherwise avoid this place like the plague

This place is an absolute joke! I go in on a Sunday evening with my husband and child and was told there was a 20-30 minute wait! There were tables that were not even being used! I mean come on now that's absolutely ridiculous! Normally my family members go there on special occasions, but after tonight I doubt we will be going there again.

Walked in on a Monday night expecting the place to be packed because of Monday night football, but the place was actually kinda empty. We were promptly seated and our drink order was taken. No problems. My wife has food allergies and they were able to provide a special menu. I also decided to be complicated and ordered a steak combo off the menu. Each time I asked for something I received a "No problem".  The regional manager also stopped by and cracked some corny jokes with us. My only real complaint was that the portions were small. The split lobster tail was the size of two shrimps. I'd consider coming back but I would also look in the area for alternatives.

Unforseen issues here. We, a party of 4, came in late one night for appetizers and drinks. The service was terrible. We did not get our drinks till 10 minutes AFTER  our food was delivered. The server never came back, our drinks were only refilled once after we asked. We finally got our check after a very, very long wait. When we received our check the lousy server added a 18% gratuity to the check--- for what??? Doing nothing??? Asked for a manager and she arrived at the table with the server and said it's policy and there is nothing she can do because we did not tell her before we received our check.... very rude, very unprofessional and definately not any kind of customer service whatsoever. There is also nothing posted anywhere about an 18% gratuity. It's sad because I like TGI Fridays. Not this one and not this staff. Won't be back for terrible service and aweful customer service from the management.

What do you want me to say here??     It's Fridays same food world wide in some states the prices are like fine dinning. Here they were reasonable.   I liked Fridays in my younger days for cold beers and greasy apps. Now however I would just prefer to avoid it.

Fridays was my favorite restaurant for so long. My sister and I went literally every Friday for years and I always got the Cajun Chicken and Shrimp pasta. However, recently the quality of the food along with the service has dropped dramatically. So much so that my sister and I are looking for a new spot.  What's wrong- most time the food is not prepared with any kind of care or tact or passion. It tastes package wrapped and a little well done if you know what I mean. 1 month ago I sent the same pasta back to the kitchen 3 times. The noodles were stuck together and disgusting and was ready to settle for an empty stomach but then they sent the kitchen manager out and he made the pasta 'from scratch' for me.  Isn't it already supposed to be from scratch? Plus my party had to hunt the server down with other servers. Constantly. If you want to enjoy your meal and evening skip this location.

This place is hit or miss for me, the food is always good but the service is lacking.  My wife and I went here last night for dinner.  The waitress never asked if wanted a refill had to flag down the passing manager to get me another coke. We barley saw her the whole time.  Also when the server came with the receipt to sign, she asked us if we needed a pen

Wow...we've been at TGIFriday's a couple of times recently and have been impressed with the BIG changes they have made in menu choices. My pot stickers and Korean tacos were not only interesting and quite a departure from former choices there but very flavorful as well. The bf was quite happy with his wedge salad but found the Parmesan crusted flounder to be delicious.  The only problems with the meal were that the sides came out not as ordered and the main courses came out quite far apart, time-wise.  We seem to be adding Fridays as a choice in our repertoire, even though we've both been kinda against most of these type of chain restaurants. 3 1/2 stars

First of all let's be serious here these muthafuckas serve that frozen shit on the whole damn menu and all yall still cough up everything in yo wallet so do us all a favor and just go to a grocery store and buy the same damn shit for a lot less

The food and service were terrible! First things first I tried to order the sizzling sirloin and spinach dinner without the onions but the waiter said he couldn't because the onions were already mixed into the sauce. That was a major disappointment since I can't have onions in my diet. So I had to revise my selection and order the California turkey club sandwich. However, the sandwich tasted like something that came out of a package and the fries were really cold like they were just flown in from the North Pole. The service was really slow. My waiter disappeared and I didn't see my bill for like 20 minutes. I spoke with the manager but he didn't seem like he cared about it. He only offered me some additional fries or a dessert on him which tasted horrible as well. Too much sugar and I felt sick afterwards. Would I go back to this place? Probably not!

This restaurant has horrible service, bad food and can't even make a drink. I had to send my steak and manhattan drink back twice. The manager apologized and said he would give me a refund of my bill because he didn't think they could meet simple standards. Don't spend your time or money here!

As a beacon of mega-chains, this location doesn't really have much that's redeeming.  It's overly expensive - I was shocked when the bill came. Over $8 for a shitty 20 oz. beer?!? Hell no.  It was REALLY crowded really early, and freakishly loud. I had a hard time hearing my girlfriend who was sitting shoulder-to-shoulder with me at the bar.  The service was OK, but really airheaded. I mean, I ordered some spicy boneless chicken wings with bleu cheese. When she finished getting the order, she asked me if I wanted ranch or bleu cheese. She came back a second later to ask if I wanted boneless or bone-in wings. A few seconds after that, she asked what level of spice I wanted. Seriously, three options, and she had to check each one. Oy. The wings were actually pretty good, which kept this from being a 1-star review. But I'm pretty sure I won't be hitting up another TGIF anytime soon.
Food was decent but the service was slow and I went on a Monday. I like the Oak Lawn location a bit better but they get super busy at times.

This is the first time I have walked out of a restaurant and felt physically ill.  Maybe it was because we spent $50 on a shitty dinner and shitty service at a shitty place. The waitress named Lashera (or something) was unfriendly, inattentive and just plain sucked.  After my husband's steak was undercooked and he had to wait over 10 minutes while they reheated it (yum), she did not even apologize once.  Nothing was offered in compensation for having to wait.  It seemed like she could care less about it. The ribs (if you can call them that) had like 2 bites of meat on them.  The reheated sauce was disgusting and the potatoes were dry. I will never be back to a Friday's again.

The epic road trip is over, but by the time we arrived in Chicago, I was starving!  Thankfully, there is a T.G.I. Friday's next to our hotel, so I ordered take out from their gluten free menu. The choices are basically steak, ribs, shrimp or salad.  I chose ribs with veggies and my favorite, mashed potatoes.  Now it's time for a nap on a pillowy soft bed.  After two 7 hr. car rides in two days, I'm plum tuckered out!  When I wake up, I'm having T.G.I. Friday's for dinner too.  I don't want to see the inside of a car for at least 24 hours. =) For more gluten free restaurant reviews, check out  !

Your typical TGIF, with good food and good drinks. Customer service is always on the upside here, and they really spend their time making sure you're satisfied and have everything you need. There isn't a time I can't remember managers walking around asking people how their food was, because they've done it the 6 or 7 times I've been here. They are a bit more pricey than chilis and don't have deals like Chilis does but the food is good and really filling. One time they did charge my boyfriend's debit card twice, neither amount which was on our bill, but they ended up fixing it and we haven't had an issue since.

The food is great, but the service is very mediocre. I've eaten here several times because it's so close to home, but every time I go here I have to wait FOREVER to get acknowledged and receive a menu.

You know what you're getting at TGI Friday's it's a for sure thing good food good service and good location I had the ribs and shrimp delicious the ribs came out hot like they were off the Grill, The wife had Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp which was also delicious, you can't go wrong with this place.

The portions of the food here reminds me of a sweater that used to fit you in high school, the more you see it, the smaller it gets. I have had multiple visits to this TGIF and for the most part they have been positive excluding an incident where I was charged twice for my meal after using my debit card....but besides that its an ok establishment. The customer service is always good and the food is too no matter how much it shrinks over time.

Really bad experience! When we were finally seated, our waiter Mike failed to bring us place settings, water, & straws. When we asked him for these items, he became agitated and gave us the impression that we were asking him to go above & beyond his normal duties. One member of our party received the wrong cocktail and when he requested that it be prepared correctly, the waiter snapped back at him stating that this particular drink was being prepared this way all night. Our friend stated that he wasn't trying to give him a hard time but he was at the restaurant the previous night and had the same drink because it's one of his favorite cocktails & it was not prepared correctly. The waiter grabbed the drink and stormed off. When the food finally arrived, our fries were cold so we had to ask the waiter if they could be replaced and then the replacement drink came; unfortunately, it still wasn't correct. The manager stopped by and we informed him about what was going on and he brought the correct cocktail over. Overall it was far from a great experience.

Waited 10 minutes for a table, but as we were finally being escorted to our table noticed that there was a whole bunch of empty (clean) tables & booths. Sat down & waited another 15 minutes before we were even greeted by a waitress.  Food was okay, as usual you get what you pay for...
